strings.Value: {g|Divine4_1}[Choice effects]{/g} [Pay 100 BP] "We shall build this library of magic. It will spur the development of mystical arts."
"We can do without a magic library. There are more urgent matters before us."

{n}Tsanna pats her rat gently. Her rat's grey body is swollen, as if it were carrying a brood of twin-headed beasts.{/n} "Your pack grows like rabbits, and your mages multiply along with the rest. You should find yourself an advisor, a Magister, to look after these spellcasters and keep them on a tight leash. You might find my methods for establishing order too rough."

"Speaking of spellcasters. A few worshipers of {g|Nethys}Nethys{/g} have traveled here from {g|Absalom}Absalom{/g}. They await you in the hallway. They seek to construct a library of magic in your capital, to make it a center of sacred knowledge for all the {g|River Kingdoms}River Kingdoms{/g}. Were I in your place, I would say yes. Such power might come in handy in making your subjects more... open-minded about the worshipping of Lamashtu."

{n}Harrim broods and mumbles, then clears his throat.{/n} "Listen, {name}. I wish to give you some advice: find another advisor who can deal with affairs of magic. The {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom} will struggle without a Magister. It is dangerous to leave such important issues unattended."

"Before you appoint someone for this position, I will take upon myself this final case, involving wizards and other spellcasters. A group of {g|Nethys}Nethys'{/g} priests have arrived at your court, to propose an amazing thing: founding a library of magic – here, in the capital. Your barony would gain a valuable store of knowledge, that would otherwise fade into darkness. I believe this deed is worthy of you and your {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom}."
"I agree. I will convey your message to the priests of {g|Nethys}Nethys{/g}."

"{mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}, I... we need another advisor, who is equipped to deal with issues of magic. In the past I have spent some of my time on these affairs, but now the population of the {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom} – and my congregation – has grown so much that I simply cannot handle the extra responsibility!"

"Oh, and another thing: a delegation of {g|Nethys}Nethys{/g} worshipers has come to us from {g|Absalom}Absalom{/g}. They've dragged a miniature of some magical library with them. They say they want to build it here, in your capital. If I were you, I'd send them back the way they came. – We've enough on our plate without the crazy projects of a crazy god."
"I will immediately pass this news to the priests of {g|Nethys}Nethys{/g}."
{n}Jhod nods.{/n} "Don't worry about what to tell them. I'll find the right words. The priests of {g|Nethys}Nethys{/g} will see their folly and leave in peace."
"Well, then there shan't be any {g|Nethys}Nethys{/g} archives in the capital. We can do just fine without them."
"I will agree to the project." {n}Harrim bows slightly.{/n}
"I will inform the priests of {g|Nethys}Nethys{/g}s that we accept their offer."
